description.raw:
During startup sequence, enable STAND behavior earlier, before the robot hits the ground, to address issue #376.

Previously, the robot, in STAND_PREP, was dropped at t=9.7s.  Then, at t=10s, STAND was engaged.  It looks to me like this is too late to engage STAND, at least when using the v3_with_v1_inertia model (I don't know why the same thing doesn't happen with the v1 model itself).

This pull request engages STAND at t=9.8s, in an attempt to ensure that the robot is already standing when it hits the ground.  I don't know whether t=9.8s is the best value, but in my testing it results in a standing robot with v1, v3, and v3_with_v1_inertia models.
